Package gameElements.pieces

Class GamePiece

java.lang.Object
gameElements.pieces.GamePiece
Direct Known Subclasses:
Bishop, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
public abstract class GamePiece extends Object
the GamePiece represents a piece on a chess board
Author:
hfeng636

  • Constructor Details

    • GamePiece

      public GamePiece(int r, int c, Board brd, boolean wht)
      creates a new alive GamePiece in the given row, column, board, and color
      Parameters:
      r - the row in which to place the piece
      c - the column in which to place the piece
      brd - the board in which to place the piece
      wht - the color of the piece

    • GamePiece

      public GamePiece()
      constructs a GamePiece

  • Method Details

    • act

      public void act()
      causes the gamePiece to act. When acting, the gamepiece will check if its health is less than or equal to 0, check if its target is untargetable, set a new target if it doesnt already have one, get all possible moves, get the best move, move to the best move, get all attack targets, damage those targets, and check if its health is less than or equal to 0

    • calcMoveLocs

      public abstract ArrayList<Location> calcMoveLocs()
      Finds all possible move locations for the GamePiece
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of Locations indicating all possible move locations

    • getMoveLoc

      public abstract Location getMoveLoc(ArrayList<Location> moves)
      chooses a move from all possible moves
      Parameters:
      moves - an ArrayList of Locations indicating all possible move locations
      Returns:
      a Location object indicating the chosen move

    • moveTo

      public void moveTo(Location newLoc)
      moves the GamePiece to the given location
      Parameters:
      newLoc - the location to which the GamePiece should move

    • getScan

      public GamePiece getScan(int scanRad)
      returns a new target GamePiece given a scan radius over which it should scan for the target
      Parameters:
      scanRad - the scanRadius to search through to find a target
      Returns:
      a target, or null if nothing was found, or the current target if this GamePiece already has a target

    • setImgCode

      public void setImgCode(int imgCode)
      sets this GamePiece's imgCode to the given imgCode
      Parameters:
      imgCode - the imgCode to set current imgCode to

      returns this GamePiece's imgCode
